newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: Warehouse details higher qtrly sales.
newsitem.headline: Warehouse details higher qtrly sales.

text.p: Discount retailer The Warehouse Limited on Thursday reported a 15.4 percent rise in sales in the three months to April 30, to NZ$135 million.
The company said year to date sales were NZ$496 million.
This was $65 million, or 15.1 percent, above that for the corresponding period last year.
Same-store sales increased 7.2 percent for the quarter and 4.8 percent for the nine months April 30.
The Warehouse retail stores recorded unaudited sales for the quarter of $129 million, up 15.2 percent on sales in the corresponding three months last year ($112 million).
Sales for the nine months ended April, of $479 million, were 14.9 percent above the $417 million achieved for the corresponding nine month period last year.

Warehouse stationery unaudited sales for the three months were $6 million, an increase of 20 percent over the same period last year. Sales for the nine months ended 30/04/97 were $17 million, up 21 percent on last year.
